entry.title: First Annual Umpqua Valley Food Rally Brings in Over $2,000 and More Than a Ton of Food
entry.summary: The first annual Umpqua Valley Food Rally collected 2,176 pounds of food and raised $2,128 to support families across Douglas County. Planned in just three weeks, the event drew strong community turnout and organizers say it will now become an annual tradition.

entry.title: WAID to Host Free Community Christmas Celebration on December 12
entry.summary: WAID will host the 2025 Free Community Christmas on Dec. 12 at the Winston Community Center, featuring Santa, live entertainment, contests, a cake walk, refreshments, and raffle prizes. The event is free for all, with donations still welcomed to support the celebration.

entry.title: 3rd Annual Winston-Dillard Festival Association Christmas Ball Set for Dec. 13
entry.summary: The 3rd Annual Winston-Dillard Festival Association Christmas Ball returns Dec. 13 with live music by Borrowed Time, refreshments by Freed Estate Winery, and a festive evening of dancing at the Winston Community Center. Tickets are on sale now.

entry.title: Roseburg seeks volunteers for downtown holiday decorating blitz
entry.summary: Downtown Roseburg is gearing up for the holiday season, and community organizers are calling for volunteers to help with decorations.

entry.title: Urgent search for missing Roseburg woman with mental health issues
entry.summary: Authorities in Douglas County are seeking help from the public to find a woman who went missing from Roseburg on Thursday, according to the Douglas County Sheriff's Office.

entry.title: NOAA Cuts Funding for Alaska Seismic Monitoring, Raising Concerns Over Tsunami Readiness
entry.summary: Funding cuts by NOAA have halted real-time seismic data from the Alaska Earthquake Center, raising concerns about reduced accuracy in tsunami forecasting. Emergency officials warn that the loss of nearby sensors increases uncertainty and could impact coastal evacuation decisions.

entry.title: The FISH of Roseburg Food Pantry holds first The Umpqua Valley Food Rally in Roseburg
entry.summary: Before Barbara Clithero drove away from The Umpqua Valley Food Rally and volunteers sorted through her donated bag of food, she said it was for one reason: Her duty to her community.

entry.title: Douglas County Commissioners issue rural health proclamation, approve court grants
entry.summary: Wednesday's Douglas County Board of Commissioners meeting was focused on wellness and recovery, specifically for those who provide health care and specialty court services and those who receive them.

entry.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — At the 98th National FFA Convention & Expo, chapters from Douglas County joined with over 60,0000 other FFA members from across the country.

entry.title: GIVING MACHINES RETURN TO VALLEY RIVER CENTER
entry.summary: November 21, 2025 2:50 a.m. Giving Machines are returning to Valley River Center in Eugene beginning Monday. A release said they offer the community an innovative, hands-on way to support local nonprofits. Last year they raised more than $60,000 in donations. This year’s launch begins with a special opening ceremony from 9:00 a.m. to 10:00...

entry.title: EBRC Raceway Brings High-Energy RC Racing to Roseburg
entry.summary: Roseburg’s new EBRC Raceway has opened on Diamond Lake Blvd, offering a two-level indoor RC racing facility with a 1/10th-scale off-road track, pit area, and pro shop. Partnering with The Roseburg Plug, the track aims to build community and bring year-round fun to local RC enthusiasts.

entry.title: Riddle School District Board of Directors appoint interim superintendent
